intro: Seriola hieracioides, commonly known as the common hawksbeard, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk florets. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, often forming dense colonies. Its leaves are lance-shaped and hairy, while its flowers are bright yellow, attracting various pollinators. Seriola hieracioides is known for its adaptability and is considered a weed in some agricultural settings.
